snippet: Grief at a botched retouching of a church fresco has turned to gratitude for divine intervention — the blessing of free publicity — that has made Borja, Spain, a magnet for thousands of curious tourists.
abstract: Borja Journal; residents of Borja, Spain, once aggrieved over local woman Cecilia Gimenez's botched restoration of a century-old fresco of Jesus, are now grateful for her work; earnest, though utterly failed restoration became a matter of global interest and an internet meme, and has since made town a magnet for thousands of curious tourists.
lead_paragraph: Grief at a botched retouching of a church fresco has turned to gratitude for divine intervention — the blessing of free publicity — that has made Borja, Spain, a magnet for thousands of curious tourists.

headline.main: A Town, if Not a Painting, Is Restored
